page.title: 04PEOPLE No.2 (LAMPHEY)
page.content: When Mr.Ashley Davies was a boy in 1930 there were 42 houses in Lamphey. Cottages were small with 3 or 4 rooms. There were no bathrooms or indoor toilets.Some families had many children.To save space beds folded into cupboards in daytime.One bed could sleep four children,two at the top and two at the bottom.Furniture was plain and made of wood.Food was cooked over the kitchen fire.A few houses had a coal fired range.Water had to be collected each day from the village pump.The coal was bagged at the railway station and taken to the houses on trucks.The coal dust was mixed with wet clay or slime and made into balls to burn on the fire.
